Node.definition: = action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions

Node.gloss: to be stubborn|to be stiff necked
Node.definition: literally: to harden one's neck, heart; = action by which humans show themselves to be stubborn and unwilling to yield
= a very short interval of time

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= action by which humans or animals make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= causative action where human or deities cause (other) humans to feel and show great joy
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= woman that sells her body for payment, making of this her profession; ≈ often associated with shame and sinful behavior

= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment
= a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= practices that conform to the laws of God

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to tear down|to demolish|to ruin|to raze|to overthrow
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone tears down a construction
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

Node.gloss: to cause to flatter|to make deceitful
Node.definition: literally: to make smooth; hence: = causative action by which humans cause events to appear well intentioned, though actually being insincere
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= net of unknown size and shape; ► used for hunting birds and other animals, and also for fishing; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= causative action by which humans spread out an object, such as a piece of cloth, a net, or a document either horizontally or vertically

literally: footstep, used exclusively in a figurative way to denote part of one's journey through life; hence: = something that is being done and, when God is the agent, something that other people ought to do as well; at the same time one can easily slip and fall, which is a metaphor for failure
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= condition of a human or a spirit that is not considered morally good or pure or right; can refer to an individual, a group, or a nation
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= action by which someone shows contempt for people and ideas

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

Node.gloss: to (cause to) turn back|to cause to cease|to avert|to revoke
Node.definition: literally: to cause (an event) to turn away (from someone else); hence: = causative action by which humans cause a certain condition in which they are not personally involved to come to an end
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions
= action by which humans act in a way that is inspired by violent anger, ≈ which is considered foolish behavior

= action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right

Node.gloss: to search|to seek|to look for|to investigate
Node.definition: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another|= action by which humans make an intensive effort to obtain in depth information about a certain object or event

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
literally: to bring out (one's) spirit; hence: = action by which humans give full vent to their anger without holding anything back, ≈ which is regarded as a foolish deed

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion

Node.gloss: to hold back|to still|to calm|to control
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities have the ability to keep things from happening or stop happening
= action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
= state of being needy as a result of one's lack of monetary or physical resources, usually resulting in a lower social status with little authority or power and at the risk of being exploited

Node.gloss: to cause to shine|to give light to|to light up|radiant|resplendent
Node.definition: = action that causes something to emit or to reflect light; ≈ associated with well being and wisdom

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection
the throne representing someone's position as monarch or judge
= an adverb that specifies unending time

Node.gloss: to be established|to endure|to be secure
Node.definition: literally: to be established; hence: = process by which a condition becomes stable and can be expected to last for a long time
= stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment
= action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= action by which humans or deities stop caring for (other) humans or objects as if that person or object has been sent away from their presence

Node.gloss: to put to shame|to bring shame
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone causes someone else to forfeit the respect of the community, by provoking a situation that is not in accordance to that person's status
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= action by which humans or deities respond to negative behavior of (other) humans by administering some sort of punishment, which may range from a verbal rebuke to physical correction, ► often done with corrective intent, but sometimes also as retribution
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= things, such as food or certain events, that bring about extreme joy to humans

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= experience by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= state of being considered fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of admiration

= action by which humans or deities respond to negative behavior of (other) humans by administering some sort of punishment, which may range from a verbal rebuke to physical correction, ► often done with corrective intent, but sometimes also as retribution

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= action by which humans focus their eyes on someone or something in order to see it well
= state in which humans feel pressed to act quickly; ≈ often associated with a lack of wisdom

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= action by which humans treat other humans with extreme indulgence

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= pertaining to being the last part of an event, close to its moment of completion
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= causative action by which humans provoke other humans to anger and so cause conflicts
= state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons
= person engaged in a certain activity
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= action by which humans divide an object (or range of objects) into portions and share them out among each other
= human who secretly takes possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it
= person who experiences hostily towards someone else and acts accordingly

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= action by which the name of a deity is invoked and asked to punish a wrong doer; ◄ contexts in which this may happen include: (1) covenants and agreements, where the deity is asked to punish those who do not obey the terms of the agreement, (2) cases where a supposedly wrongful act has been committed, but where there is not enough certainty about the identity of the person who is responsible, and (3) in order to prevent people from committing a wrongful action, knowing that the deity's punishment will be upon them if they do so
= state/process by which humans experience a strong fear, usually accompanied by shaking and trembling
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
literally: to seek (someone's) face); hence: = action by which humans make an intensive effort to be in the presence of another human or deity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= the outcome of a dispute between two or more parties, decided by a judge or a deity
= people, animals, and inanimate objects that are considered utterly wrong and detestable, because of their condition, their behavior, or because of certain customs
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= the state of being or acting in an unjust or morally evil way
= people, animals, and inanimate objects that are considered utterly wrong and detestable, because of their condition, their behavior, or because of certain customs
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
